question.title: Taking input - Java
question.content:
In this problem we will learn how to read inputs.
You are given five inputs: a(integer), b(float ), c(long), d(byte), and s(string) respectively. 
You need to use the scanner class object and then take all the input and print each in a new line.
Note: Consider using sc.nextLine( ) after byte input to handle any issues with input reading.
Read: Java I/O

rephrased.body: You are given five inputs: an integer `a`, a float `b`, a long `c`, a byte `d`, and a string `s`. Your task is to read these inputs using the `Scanner` class in Java and print each of them on a new line.  Remember to use `sc.nextLine()` after reading the byte input to avoid potential input reading issues.

hints: Use different input methods for taking different types of inputs.
